text: mineral water update: made two 5 gallon batches today. one is a special slovakian birthday water, klastorna: <http://www.klastorna.sk/>  It has quite a bit of magnesium sulfate compared to gerolsteiner and borsec so might have an acquired taste. The other is another batch of gerolsteiner.
carbonating now. note to <@U026PT0D7>: it would be useful to have multiple co2 hookups and multiple dispensing taps
tasting notes: initial flavors of hose and swimming pool mellowing to a neutral, light, airiness. Epsom salts seem to mask the carbonates and other dissolved solids well without imparting much taste.
side-by-side with water from sammy made the sammy water seem _very_ heavy, but they both had basically no salty flavor (which has been, for me, the earmark of these experiments thus far)
san pellegrino was especially salty. maybe to keep the pilgrims stocked with electrolytes?
This little calculator app looks pretty awesome (not as good as Soulver but still cool). <http://numi.io/>

attachments.title: Numi — Beautiful Calculator App for Mac OS
attachments.text: Numi is a calculator for Mac that magically blends calculations with text.
